Sentence.sentence: In addition, other factors are putting downward pressure on oil prices: change in the strategic behavior of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries, the projected increase in Iranian exports, the scaling-down of global demand ( ' , especially from emerging markets), the long-term drop in petroleum consumption in the United States, and some displacement of oil by substitutes.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Workplace norms pressure employees to overwork, deterring them from taking paid time off.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Without sustained external pressure it seems certain Mr.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Pressure from tobacco manufacturers remains strong.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Harvard Business School professor Leslie Perlow explains that when people feel the pressure to be always on,  they find ways to accommodate that pressure, including altering their schedules, work habits and interactions  with  family  and  friends.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: But that isn't why the government—under pressure from cancer charities, health workers and the Labour party—has agreed to legislate for standardised packaging.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: But even when  employees are given paid time off, workplace norms and expectations that pressure them to overwork often  prevent them from taking it.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: And even before then, scholars warn, the demand for resources in an energy-hungry world could raise pressure to renegotiate Antarctica's treaties, possibly allowing more commercial endeavours here well before the prohibitions against them expire.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: If you want to change his course, you have only a few choices: you can stop him, transferring ( ' , possibly painfully) some of his kinetic energy ( ' ,  动能 ) to your own body, or you can approach alongside and slowly apply pressure to gradually alter his course.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Rising population combined with improved nutrition standards and shifting dietary preferences will exert pressure for increases in global food supply.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: However, pressure will grow on finite resources of land, energy and water
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: At certain stages of life, especially adolescence, the pressure to be seen as similar to peers is immense.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: According to Harry Vallentine, a Canadian engineer who is researching modern steam technology, a special tank measuring 2 by 10 metres could store over 750 kilowatt hours of energy as high pressure steam, enough to pull a two-cart train for an hour or so.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: But even when employees are given paid time off, workplace norms and expectations that pressure them to overwork often prevent them from taking it.
Sentence.come: 2016年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: But it's not only women who are affected by this pressure to look good.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Harvard Business School professor Leslie Perlow explains that when people feel the pressure to be always "on,"they find ways to accommodate that pressure, including altering their schedules, work habits and interactions with family and friends.
Sentence.come: 2016年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: If there's a downward pressure on costs, because of a need for investment in other areas, I would argue that this is a perfectly feasible solution.
Sentence.come: 2016年12月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: If you want to change his course, you have only a few choices: you can stop him, transferring possibly painfullysome of his kinetic energy to your own body, or toucan approach alongside and slowly apply pressure to gradually alter his course.
Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.come: 2017年6月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: The gas can be stored under pressure in a tank.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: The quite dramatic unemployment figures, which we now see in some of the countries, strongly suggest that there will be greater pressure on wages in the future, as more people will be unemployed, more people will be looking for jobs and the pressure on em
Sentence.come: 2016年6月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section B

Sentence.sentence: This unique ecosystem may soon be under pressure.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: We should assure such students that risk, and even peer pressure, can be a good thing—as long as it happens in the classroom and not in the car.

Sentence.sentence: When considering risk factors associated with serious chronic diseases, we often think about health indicators such as cholesterol, blood pressure, and body weight.

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"压力，重压，紧张"之意。
means: strain ： 指某人为克服外力界压力而造成的身心和情绪等方面的压抑。用于物时，指任何力或合力作用于一个物体上面造成的应变。
stress ： 侧重指承受外来的压力，也指由于某种原因而引起的心理、生理或情绪上的紧张。
pressure ： 在科学上，指单位面积上所受到的压力。用于引申时，指某事物所产生的压力或影响力等。
tension ： 多指因关系不好或其它原因而出现的紧张状态，也指某物被过度伸展的程度或状态。

stems_affixes.value_cn: 可压缩的, 可压榨的
stems_affixes.word_buile: compress[v.压缩]+ible能……的→adj.可压缩的, 可压榨的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 沮丧的,抑郁的;不景气的,萧条的
stems_affixes.word_buile: depress[v.压制,压抑]+ed……的→adj.沮丧的,抑郁的;不景气的,萧条的
ex出+press挤压→把[思想]挤出来→表达

stems_affixes.value_cn: 给人深刻印象的,感人的
stems_affixes.word_buile: impress印象,引人注目+ive……的→adj.给人深刻印象的,感人的
press挤压+ing……的→adj.急迫的
compress[v.压缩]+ion表名词→n.压缩,压紧,浓缩
depress[v.压制,压抑]+ion表名词→n.消沉;不景气萧条期
ex出+press挤压→把[思想]挤出来→表达

stems_affixes.value_cn: 表达;表情;声调;腔调;榨出;措词;式;符号
stems_affixes.word_buile: express表达,表示+ion→n.表达;表情;声调;腔调;榨出;措词;式;符号
impress印象,引人注目+ion表名词→n.印象,感想;盖印,压痕
oppress[v.压迫,压制]+ion表名词→n.压迫

stems_affixes.value_cn: 压,压力,压迫,强制,紧迫,困苦,困难
stems_affixes.word_buile: press挤压+ure表名词→n.压,压力,压迫,强制,紧迫,困苦,困难
suppress[v.镇压,压制]+ion表名词→n.镇压,压制
press挤压→n.&n.&v.压, 按
com一起+press压→一起压→压缩
de向下+press压→向下压→压制→情绪低下
ex出+press挤压→把[思想]挤出来→表达
im进+press挤压→压进去→盖印→印入头脑→留下印象
op加强动作+press挤压→拼命压→压迫
re回+press挤压→压回去
sup下+press压→压下去

word_mean: 压〔力〕，压迫：压、拉、推或切的应力
［step-type］ controller, pressure switch 又称“压力开关”。当压力达到设定值时进行位式控制或(和)报警的仪表。
pressure-filled ther-mometer 利用充灌式感温系统测量温度的仪表。
作用于单位面积上的压力。
pressure-time method, Gibson  method  又称“吉布森法”。
全称“压力强度”。流体沿某一平面的法线方向作用于该面上的每单位面积上的力，力的方向指向被作用的面。

Sentence.sentence: Big companies could relieve data security pressure.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读C 选项

Sentence.sentence: But what starts as fun usage of apps turns into tremendous pressure in real social media interaction at secondary school.

Sentence.sentence: By the time they started secondary school—at age 11—children were already far more aware of their image online and felt under huge pressure to ensure their posts were popular, the report found.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: Dad pulled out a pressure cooker and filled it up with cabbages, eggplants, potatoes, corns, onions and carrots.

Sentence.sentence: Finally, dad turned off the stove, the pot began to cool and the pressure relief valve sprayed out a cloud of steam.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语四川卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: Governments could relieve their financial pressure.

Sentence.sentence: If you have a tension headache, you may also feel the pressure on both sides of your head.

Sentence.sentence: In fact, women are less likely to have high blood pressure or to die from heart attacks.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语四川卷 阅读理解 七选五 原文

Sentence.sentence: It turns out that just looking at green,growing things can reduce stress,lower blood pressure,and put people into a better mood.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语全国卷I 阅读理解 七选五 原文

Sentence.sentence: Many of our conversations are gossip, I have noticed three effects of gossip: It can hurt people, it can give gossipers a strange kind of satisfaction, and it can cause social pressures in a group.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语浙江卷（6月） 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: She said social media firms were exposing children to major emotional risks, with some youngsters starting secondary school ill-equipped to cope with the tremendous pressure they faced online.

Sentence.sentence: The pressures of "time" and "destination" are further blocks to awareness.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: The need of training is too evident; the pressure to accomplish a change in their attitude and habits is too urgent to leave these consequences wholly out of account.
Sentence.come: 出自-2009年考研翻译原文

Sentence.sentence: The IASB says it does not want to act without overall planning, but the pressure to fold when it completes it reconstruction of rules later this year is strong.

Sentence.sentence: But by giving in to critics now they are inviting pressure to make more concessions.

Sentence.sentence: Members of social networks, for instance, are learning that they can hijack media to apply pressure on the businesses that originally created them.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: As boards scrutinize succession plans in response to shareholder pressure, executives who don’t get the nod also may wish to move on.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: This is a subtle form of peer pressure: we unconsciously imitate the behavior we see every day.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: That whispered message, half invitation and half forcing, is what most of us think of when we hear the words peer pressure.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Rosenberg argues convincingly that public-health advocates ought to take a page from advertisers, so skilled at applying peer pressure.

Sentence.sentence: Join the Club is filled with too much irrelevant detail and not enough exploration of the social and biological factors that make peer pressure so powerful.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Her critique of the lameness of many pubic-health campaigns is spot-on: they fail to mobilize peer pressure for healthy habits, and they demonstrate a seriously flawed understanding of psychology.

Sentence.sentence: But in her new book Join the Club, Tina Rosenberg contends that peer pressure can also be a positive force through what she calls the social cure, in which organizations and officials use the power of group dynamics to help individuals improve their lives and possibly the word.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: There is pressure for change from within the profession, but opponents of change among the regulators insist that keeping outsiders out of a law firm isolates lawyers from the pressure to make money rather than serve clients ethically.

Sentence.sentence: Under lobby pressure，George Osborne favours rural new-build against urban renovation and renewal.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: In Denmark, the United States, and a few other countries, it is trying to set voluntary standards for models and fashion images that rely more on peer pressure for enforcement.

Sentence.sentence: Hill’s pressure later led to creation of national parks and green belts.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Complex international, economic, technological and culture change could start to diminish the leading position of English as the language of the world market, and UK interests which enjoy advantage from the breath of English usage would consequently face new pressures.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年考研翻译原文

sentence.from: 2016年高考英语上海卷 语法填空 B 原文

entry.def: Pressure is force that you produce when you press hard on something.

example.ex: She kicked at the door with her foot, and the pressure was enough to open it...
example.tran: 她用脚踢门，力气之大足以把门踹开。

example.ex: The pressure of his fingers had relaxed...
example.tran: 他手指按压的力道减轻了。

entry.def: The pressure in a place or container is the force produced by the quantity of gas or liquid in that place or container.

example.ex: The window in the cockpit had blown in and the pressure dropped dramatically...
example.tran: 驾驶舱的窗户突然向内破裂，气压急剧降低。

example.ex: Warm air is now being drawn in from another high pressure area over the North Sea.
example.tran: 暖气流正从北海上空的另一个高气压带移动过来。

entry.def: If there is pressure on a person, someone is trying to persuade or force them to do something.

example.ex: He may have put pressure on her to agree...
example.tran: 他可能向她施加了压力，迫使她同意。

example.ex: Its government is under pressure from the European Commission...
example.tran: 其政府承受着来自欧盟委员会的压力。

entry.def: If you are experiencing pressure, you feel that you must do a lot of tasks or make a lot of decisions in very little time, or that people expect a lot from you.

example.ex: Even if I had the talent to play tennis I couldn't stand the pressure...
example.tran: 即使我有打网球的天赋，我也无法承受这种压力。

entry.def: If you pressure someone to do something, you try forcefully to persuade them to do it.

example.ex: He will never pressure you to get married...
example.tran: 他永远不会强迫你结婚。

example.ex: The Government should not be pressured into making hasty decisions...
example.tran: 政府不应该迫于压力仓促作出决定。

means.word_mean: 1. the force applied to a unit area of surface; measured in pascals (SI unit) or in dynes (cgs unit);

sentences.sentence: "the compressed gas exerts an increased pressure"
"the public brought pressure to bear on the government"

means.word_mean: 3. the act of pressing; the exertion of pressure;

sentences.sentence: "he used pressure to stop the bleeding"

means.word_mean: 4. the state of urgently demanding notice or attention;

sentences.sentence: "the sensitivity of his skin to pressure and temperature was normal"

means.word_mean: 6. an oppressive condition of physical or mental or social or economic distress
1. to cause to do through pressure or necessity, by physical, moral or intellectual means :"She forced him to take a job in the city";
2. exert pressure on someone through threats

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French, from Latin pressura, from press- 'pressed', from the verb premere (see press)

sentences.cn: 护士压住他的胳膊止血。
sentences.en: The nurse applied pressure to his arm to stop the bleeding.

sentences.cn: 拥挤的人群把路障推倒了。
sentences.en: The barriers gave way under the pressure of the crowd.

sentences.cn: 不要勉强自己仓促作出决定。

sentences.cn: 他永远不会强迫你结婚。
sentences.en: He will never pressure you to get married...

sentences.cn: 政府不应该迫于压力仓促作出决定。
sentences.en: The Government should not be pressured into making hasty decisions...

sentences.cn: 气象学家认为这一气压的突然升高是暴风雨和飓风形成的物理机制.
sentences.en: Meteorologist believe this pressure jump is the mechanism responsible for storm and tornado.

sentences.cn: 他在别人的逼迫之下改变了主意.
sentences.en: He changed his mind under the pressure from others.

sentences.cn: 木块受压时可缩小很多.
sentences.en: Wood blocks may compress a great deal under pressure.

sentences.cn: 政府受到压力,被要求放宽审查制度.
sentences.en: The government is under pressure to relax censorship regulations.

sentences.cn: 空气 / 水的压力
sentences.en: air/water pressure

sentences.cn: 政府最终向群众的压力低头。
sentences.en: The government eventually bowed to popular pressure (= they agreed to do what people were trying to get them to do) .

sentences.cn: 青少年可能觉得很难抗拒同龄人的压力。
sentences.en: Teenagers may find it difficult to resist peer pressure .

sentences.cn: 你要能应付这一工作的压力。
sentences.en: You need to be able to handle pressure in this job.

sentences.cn: 怎么会有人喜欢都市生活的压力呢？
sentences.en: How can anyone enjoy the pressures of city life?

sentences.cn: 主任面对被迫请辞的压力越来越大。
sentences.en: The director is under increasing pressure to resign.

sentences.cn: 这个队在压力下表现良好。
sentences.en: The team performs well under pressure.

sentences.cn: 他可能向她施加了压力，迫使她同意。
sentences.en: He may have put pressure on her to agree...

sentences.cn: 其政府承受着来自欧盟委员会的压力。
sentences.en: Its government is under pressure from the European Commission...

sentences.cn: 你能在压力下工作吗？
sentences.en: Can you work under pressure?...

sentences.cn: 即使我有打网球的天赋，我也无法承受这种压力。
sentences.en: Even if I had the talent to play tennis I couldn't stand the pressure...

sentences.cn: 政府不应该迫于压力仓促作出决定。
sentences.en: The Government should not be pressured into making hasty decisions...

sentences.cn: 国际会计准则理事会表示，他们不想在没有总体规划的情况下采取行动，但今年晚些时候，就在他们完成自身准则重建之时，外界要求他们屈服的压力变得十分巨大。
sentences.en: The IASB says it does not want to act without overall planning，but the pressure to fold when it completes its reconstruction of rules later this year is strong.

sentences.cn: 但现在，他们却在批评者面前做出让步，进而带来要做出更多让步的压力。
sentences.en: But by giving in to critics now they are inviting pressure to make more concessions.

sentences.cn: 当董事会迫于股东的压力严格审查续任计划时，那些未得到首肯的高管可能也想换份工作。
sentences.en: As boards scrutinize succession plans in response to shareholder pressure, executives who don't get the nod also may wish to move on.

sentences.cn: 在听到“同侪压力”这个术语时，我们大多数人就会联想到前面这半邀请、半强迫式的话。
sentences.en: That whispered message, half invitation and half forcing, is what most of us  think of when we hear the words peer pressure.

sentences.cn: 《加入俱乐部》一书有太多无关细节，而且没有充分探究使同侪压力变得如此强大的社会和生物因素。
sentences.en: Join the Club is filled with too much irrelevant detail and not enough  exploration of the social and biological factors that make peer pressure so  powerful.

sentences.cn: 这是同侪压力的一种隐秘形式：我们不自觉地模仿我们每天看到的行为。
sentences.en: This is a subtle form of peer pressure: we unconsciously imitate the behavior we  see every day.

sentences.cn: 行业内部有要求变革的压力，但监管机构中反对变革的人坚持认为，将局外人排除在律师事务所之外能够确保律师在为客户服务时不屈从于赚钱的压力，而是恪守职业道德。
sentences.en: There is pressure for change from within the profession, but opponents of change among the regulators insist that keeping outsiders out of a law firm isolates lawyers from the pressure to make money rather than serve clients ethically.

sentences.cn: 丹麦、美国和其他一些同家，时尚界正尝试就模特和时装造型制定自愿性标准，且这些标准的实施更多地依赖于同行的压力。
sentences.en: In Denmark, the United States, and a few other countries, it is trying to set voluntary standards for models and fashion images that rely more on peer pressure for enforcement.

sentences.cn: 当今,高中毕业后直升大学存在广泛的社会压力,加之在快节奏发展的世界中,人们的期望也变得越来越高,这两者往往导致学生彻底忽略休学一年的可能性。
sentences.en: Today, widespread social pressure to immediately go to college in conjunction with increasingly high expectations in a fast—moving world often causes students to completely overlook the possibility of taking a gap year.

sentences.cn: 但对于工厂老板来说,所有这些意味着他们将对工人展开激烈的争夺,并面临新金上涨的压力
sentences.en: For factory owners, it all adds up to staff competition for workers —and upward pressure no wages.
